p: Antioxidants play a major role in the prevention and treatment of diseases associated with oxidative damage, including cancer, cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases [ 80, 83–84]. Reactive oxygen species, including hydrogen peroxide and free radicals, such as superoxide anion (O 2 •-) and hydroxyl radical (HO •), are inevitably produced in living organisms resulting from metabolic processes or from external sources [ 81]. Continued exposure to free radicals in biological systems may cause functional and structural damage, aging and cell death [ 85].
